newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-SFE wheat futures firm in tight market.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-SFE wheat futures firm in tight market.

text.p: Australian wheat futures firmed in thin trade on Wednesday, as domestic prices edged further towards the Australian Wheat Board (AWB) pool price.
The settlement price on the spot March contract rose A$3 a tonne to A$171, with 13 50-tonne lots traded.
Dealers said there were good buying orders for May, but the contract was untraded, rising A$5 a tonne to a settlement price of A$173.50.
Phil Lindsay of Ord Minnett Jardine Fleming Futures said growers were submitting wheat to the AWB pool or storing their crop in the hope of higher prices in winter, leaving the domestic market tight.
Lindsay said he expected the domestic price would push higher in coming weeks.
"We think it will drift back up to around A$180 to A$185 a tonne," he said.
The AWB on Monday raised its 1996/97 pool return estimate by A$4 a tonne for most grades, taking Australian Standard White (ASW) to A$192 a tonne.
